issue.title: [C++] Should the default value of "check_metadata" arguments of Equals methods be "true"?
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-8069](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8069). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
We just changed the default in Python to False for usability reasons. Since C++ has different usability considerations, we don't necessarily need to have the default be the same, but I'm curious if anyone has any opinions one way or the other. I would be weakly supportive of changing the default to false

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8069?focusedCommentId=17092966) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
The default was changed to false
